page.title: 11Friston Forest Snap Hill
page.content: Snap Hill is part of a chalk ridge which extends approximately north to south for 2 km with the village of Jevington below its north-eastern edge.A tan race-track extends straight along the ridge for the training of the Jevington stabled race horses. Every morning they are brought up from the stables for exercise and sometimes the trainer is seen timing them over a measured distance.There are starting stalls with which the horses learn to become familiar.On an August morning,two horses were being timed and one of them next day came second in its race at Folkestone at 33-1.The ridge is usually deserted except for a few walkers,but in blackberry time more people are seen,picking the fruit for home-made jam.Sloes are gathered later in the autumn for jam or sloe-gin.
